channel.title: Comments on: The repoze.who LDAP plugin will be an official plugin
channel.description: Notes from a disciplined software developer

item.title: By: Gustavo
item.dc:creator: Gustavo
item.description: @raulna: I don't know about any repoze.who PAM plugin, sorry. There may be one, though.
item.content:encoded: @raulna: I don’t know about any repoze.who PAM plugin, sorry. There may be one, though.

item.title: By: raulna
item.dc:creator: raulna
item.description:
Hola Gustavo,
I have developed an application with TG2. And now I need users to authenticate with PAM. How I can do? I have been testing "repoze" with SQLAlchemy and I like it but use it with PAM. Any ideas?
Thanks
item.content:encoded:
Hola Gustavo,

I have developed an application with TG2. And now I need users to
authenticate with PAM. How I can do? I have been testing “repoze” with
SQLAlchemy and I like it but use it with PAM. Any ideas?

Thanks

item.title: By: Jim Glenn
item.dc:creator: Jim Glenn
item.description:
Hi Gustavo,
I found your demo and plugin for LDAP with repoze. I've downloaded the demo and am running.
I can easily get to http://localhost:8080/, but when I go to http://localhost:8080/about, I get an WebError Traceback.
⇝ HTTPUnauthorized: 401 Unauthorized This server could not verify that you are authorized to access the document you requested. Either you supplied the wrong credentials (e.g., bad password), or your browser does not understand how to supply the credentials required.
Any tips?
item.content:encoded:
Hi Gustavo,

I found your demo and plugin for LDAP with repoze. I’ve downloaded the demo and am running.

I can easily get to http://localhost:8080/, but when I go to http://localhost:8080/about, I get an WebError Traceback.

⇝ HTTPUnauthorized: 401 Unauthorized This server could not verify that you are authorized to access the document you requested. Either you supplied the wrong credentials (e.g., bad password), or your browser does not understand how to supply the credentials required.

Any tips?

item.title: By: Gustavo
item.dc:creator: Gustavo
item.description:
Hi, Jeff.
Please check this message: http://lists.repoze.org/pipermail/repoze-dev/2010-January/002546.html
In the mean time, please feel free to use that plugin under the terms of the Repoze License: http://repoze.org/license.html
Cheers.
item.content:encoded:
Hi, Jeff.

Please check this message:
http://lists.repoze.org/pipermail/repoze-dev/2010-January/002546.html

In the mean time, please feel free to use that plugin under the terms of the Repoze License:
http://repoze.org/license.html

Cheers.

item.title: By: Jeff
item.dc:creator: Jeff
item.description:
The resources I've identified seem to indicate that repoze.who is still GPL3 and that it is not yet an official plugin. Are those sources correct?
I've noticed this article is more than a year old. If you could provide links to documentation regarding repoze.who.plugins.ldap or confirm its inclusion and license change, that'd be nice. : )
item.content:encoded:
The resources I’ve identified seem to indicate that repoze.who is still GPL3 and that it is not yet an official plugin. Are those sources correct?

I’ve noticed this article is more than a year old. If you could provide links to documentation regarding repoze.who.plugins.ldap or confirm its inclusion and license change, that’d be nice. : )
